H0.text: One cell divides into two cells is an example of asexual reproduction.

H1.text: Two cells unite to form one cell is an example of asexual reproduction.

H2.text: A gene in a cell mutates is an example of asexual reproduction.

H3.text: Egg cells are produced is an example of asexual reproduction.

A4.text: Binary fission results in the reproduction of a living prokaryotic cell (or organelle) by dividing the cell into two parts, each with the potential to grow to the size of the original.

A5.text: The consequence of this asexual method of reproduction is that all the cells are genetically identical, meaning that they have the same genetic material (barring random mutations).
